subject: Science
title: The Oort Cloud: Edge of the Solar System
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Oort Cloud: Edge of the Solar System.

hook.text: The solar system has a boundary so far away that light takes over a year to reach it.

buildup.text: The Oort Cloud is a theoretical shell of trillions of icy objects surrounding the Sun.

discovery.text: Long-period comets that take thousands of years to orbit likely come from here.

twist.text: No spacecraft has ever reached it. Voyager 1 won't arrive for 300 years.

climax.text: The Oort Cloud may extend halfway to the nearest star.

punchline.text: The Sun's influence reaches a light-year out. Space is patient.

quiz.question: What are Oort Cloud objects primarily made of?
